abstract: <jats:p>A new species of the genus <jats:italic>Ctenosciara</jats:italic> Tuomikoski, 1960 is here described based upon a single specimen, obtained from collectings in the garden at Museum Alexander Koenig in Bonn. <jats:italic>Ctenosciara alexanderkoenigi</jats:italic><jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold> differs from all other congeneric European species by its striking coloration and distinct male genitalia. However, DNA barcoding reveals associations with two specimens from New Zealand. Therefore a recent migration of <jats:italic>Ctenosciara</jats:italic> species from the Australasian Region, the likely center of origin of the genus, is discussed. A key to the European species of <jats:italic>Ctenosciara</jats:italic> is provided. Barcoding results reveale that <jats:italic>Ctenosciara exigua</jats:italic> is not clearly distinguished from <jats:italic>Ctenosciara hyalipennis</jats:italic> by its COI sequence (both share the same BIN BOLD:AAH3983) and that its species status may be questionable.</jats:p>
title: Ctenosciara alexanderkoenigi sp. n. (Diptera: Sciaridae), an exotic invader in Germany?

affiliation.name: Zoologisches Forschungsmuseum Alexander Koenig, Bonn, Germany
